data.message: What a bunch of bull pucky. If I'm in charge then why do you keep changing my status to 'top stories?'

replies.message: Hey Todd. We've invested a lot to understand how News Feed can show the most engaging content to the majority of people. Top Stories is the result of our findings, which is why it is the default. We know that some people prefer the Most Recent view, so we've kept this option available. If you have specific thoughts you want to share, please let us know here: http://on.fb.me/1rmVirO. -Jenny
Jenny, that is a total non-answer.  We DO change it.  The question is WHY does it keep reverting back to top stories when we've set it to most recent?
Even in Most Recent, I do not get the recent posts. I am getting very frustrated about this.
I agree with D'Lynn 100%!  I've changed mine to Most Recent view so many times and after a day or two, it goes back to Top Stories!
Sometime mine stays on recent for several days and sometimes only a few hours. At least If I knew when it was going to switch on me I would know when to change it back.
He did and you showed you don't care

Still not the answer I was looking for facebook. The reason being is that most 'top stories' are at least twelve hours old, not only making them old news, but the people posting them are likely to not be around to respond to, especially those halfway across the world.
Facebook only replies once with a stupid canned answer which NEVER solves or even addresses the problem.
